item.title: Stay Ahead of Cyber Threats
item.description: Going further and faster with high-performance network security
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Unpacking the Structure of Modern Cybercrime Organizations
item.description: We examine three differently sized criminal groups to know how they compare to similarly sized legitimate businesses in terms of how they are organized. We also discuss how threat researchers can use their knowledge of the size and structure of a target criminal organization to aid their investigation.
item.dc:creator: David Sancho
Mayra Rosario Fuentes
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: S4x23 Review Part 4: Cybersecurity for Industrial IoT
item.description: In this fourth article, I introduce the discussion related to Industrial IoT, that is involved challenges to adopt cybersecurity strategy into modernizing environment.
item.dc:creator: Kazuhisa Tagaya
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Mac Malware MacStealer Spreads as Fake P2E Apps
item.description: We detected Mac malware MacStealer spreading via websites, social media, and messaging platforms Twitter, Discord, and Telegram. Cybercriminals lure victims to download it by plagiarizing legitimate play-to-earn (P2E) apps’ images and offering jobs as beta testers.
item.dc:creator: Qi Sun
Luis Magisa
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Fighting mercenaries with the Cybersecurity Tech Accord
item.description: Trend Micro co-Authors Cyber Mercenary Principles to help guide the technology industry and others in dealing with the growing market of cyber mercenaries.
item.dc:creator: Jon Clay
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: ICS/OT Cybersecurity 2022 TXOne Annual Report Insights
item.description: This article gives an in-depth overview of TXOne’s insight report on ICS/OT cyber incidents.
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Azure Serverless Security Risks Exposed by New Study
item.description: Simulation uncovers hidden features and urges greater user awareness
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: New OpcJacker Malware Distributed via Fake VPN Malvertising
item.description: We discovered a new malware, which we named “OpcJacker” (due to its opcode configuration design and its cryptocurrency hijacking ability), that has been distributed in the wild since the second half of 2022.
item.dc:creator: Jaromir Horejsi
Joseph C Chen
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Earth Preta’s Cyberespionage Campaign Hits Over 200
item.description: We present a case study of the cyberespionage efforts by Earth Preta. This study on an active campaign delves into the structure, goals, and requirements of the organizations involved, and provides an opportunity to conduct wider intelligence analysis and insights in the development of effective countermeasures.
item.category: Trend Micro Research : APT & Targeted Attacks
Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Pack it Secretly: Earth Preta’s Updated Stealthy Strategies
item.description: Earth Preta has actively been changing its tools, tactics, and procedures (TTPs) to bypass security solutions. In this blog entry, we will introduce and analyze the tools and malware used by the threat actor in its most recent campaigns.
item.dc:creator: Vickie Su
Nick Dai
Sunny Lu
item.category: Trend Micro Research : APT & Targeted Attacks
Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Patch CVE-2023-23397 Immediately: What You Need To Know and Do
item.description: We break down the basic information of CVE-2023-23397, the zero-day, zero-touch vulnerability that was rated 9.8 on the Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) scale.
item.category: Trend Micro Research : APT & Targeted Attacks
Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: S4x23 Review Part 3: Healthcare Cybersecurity Sessions
item.description: This article focuses on the healthcare sector. Over the past two years, the healthcare sector has been in a constant state of emergency due to the COVID-19 pandemic, and as widely reported in the media, it has also been threatened by cyberattacks such as ransomware.
item.dc:creator: Kazuhisa Tagaya
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Making the digital world safer, one Tesla at a time
item.description: Contestants gather at Pwn2Own Vancouver to showcase their skills and uncover vulnerabilities
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: S4x23 Review Part 2: Evolving Energy Cybersecurity
item.description: In this second report on S4x23 held last February, this article introduces the discussion on cyber security in the energy industry, which was one of the topics that attracted attention.
item.dc:creator: Kazuhisa Tagaya
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Emotet Returns, Now Adopts Binary Padding for Evasion
item.description: Following a three-month hiatus, Emotet spam activities resumed in March 2023, when a botnet known as Epoch 4 began delivering malicious documents embedded in Zip files that were attached to the emails.
item.dc:creator: Ian Kenefick
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Examining Ransomware Payments From a Data-Science Lens
item.description: In this entry, we discuss case studies that demonstrated how data-science techniques were applied in our investigation of ransomware groups' ransom transactions, as detailed in our joint research with Waratah Analytics, “What Decision-Makers Need to Know About Ransomware Risk.”
item.dc:creator: Vladimir Kropotov
Matsukawa Bakuei
Robert McArdle
Fyodor Yarochkin
Shingo Matsugaya
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Expanding Attack Blueprints: 2022 Annual Cybersecurity Report
item.description: In this blog entry, we shine a spotlight on some of the most critical cybersecurity concerns of 2022, which we discuss in full in our annual cybersecurity report, “Rethinking Tactics: 2022 Annual Security Report.”
item.dc:creator: Trend Micro Research
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: S4x23 Review Part 1: What's New in OT Security
item.description: This blog introduces discussions from S4x23, the ICS security conference in Miami over several posts. The first installment will cover two topics from the academic interviews.
item.dc:creator: Kazuhisa Tagaya
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Managed XDR Exposes Spear-Phishing Campaign Targeting Hospitality Industry Using RedLine Stealer
item.description: Find out how the Managed XDR team uncovered RedLine Stealer’s evasive spear-phishing campaign that targets the hospitality industry.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Soliven
Abraham Camba
Byron Gelera
Catherine Loveria
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Leveraging Data Science to Minimize the Blast Radius of Ransomware Attacks
item.description: In this blog entry, we present a case study that illustrates how data-science techniques can be used to gain valuable insights about ransomware groups' targeting patterns as detailed in our research paper, “What Decision-Makers Need to Know About Ransomware Risk.”
item.dc:creator: Vladimir Kropotov
Matsukawa Bakuei
Robert McArdle
Fyodor Yarochkin
Shingo Matsugaya
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Iron Tiger’s SysUpdate Reappears, Adds Linux Targeting
item.description: We detail the update that advanced persistent threat (APT) group Iron Tiger made on the custom malware family SysUpdate. In this version, we also found components that enable the malware to compromise Linux systems.
item.dc:creator: Daniel Lunghi
item.category: Trend Micro Research : APT & Targeted Attacks
Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: A Deep Dive into the Evolution of Ransomware Part 3
item.description: This 3-part blog series takes an in-depth look at the evolution of ransomware business models, from the early stages to current trends.
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Amplifying Power to Customer Through Ecosystem Integrations
item.description: Transformation to a SaaS-based cybersecurity vendor
item.dc:creator: Lonny Huffar

item.title: A Deep Dive into the Evolution of Ransomware Part 2
item.description: This 3-part blog series takes an in-depth look at the evolution of ransomware business models, from the early stages to current trends.
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Investigating the PlugX Trojan Disguised as a Legitimate Windows Debugger Tool
item.description: Trend Micro’s Managed Extended Detection and Response (MxDR) team discovered that a file called x32dbg.exe was used to sideload a malicious DLL we identified as a variant of PlugX.
item.dc:creator: Buddy Tancio
Jed Valderama
Catherine Loveria
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: A Deep Dive into the Evolution of Ransomware Part 1
item.description: This 3-part blog series takes an in-depth look at the evolution of ransomware business models, from the early stages to current trends.
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: In Review: What GPT-3 Taught ChatGPT in a Year
item.description: Amidst the uproar and opinions since November 2022, we look at the possibilities and implications of what OpenAI’s ChatGPT presents to the cybersecurity industry using a comparison to earlier products, like its predecessor GPT-3.
item.dc:creator: Vincenzo Ciancaglini
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Royal Ransomware Expands Attacks by Targeting Linux ESXi Servers
item.description: Ransomware actors have been observed to expand their targets by increasingly developing Linux-based versions. Royal ransomware is following in the same path, a new variant targeting Linux systems emerged and we will provide a technical analysis on this variant in this blog.
item.dc:creator: Nathaniel Morales
Ivan Nicole Chavez
Byron Gelera
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Earth Kitsune Delivers New WhiskerSpy Backdoor via Watering Hole Attack
item.description: We discovered a new backdoor which we have attributed to the advanced persistent threat actor known as Earth Kitsune, which we have covered before. Since 2019, Earth Kitsune has been distributing variants of self-developed backdoors to targets, primarily individuals who are interested in North Korea.
item.dc:creator: Joseph C Chen
Jaromir Horejsi
item.category: Trend Micro Research : APT & Targeted Attacks
Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Invitation to a Secret Event: Uncovering Earth Yako’s Campaigns
item.description: We detail the intrusion set Earth Yako, attributed to the campaign Operation RestyLink or EneLink. This analysis was presented in full at the JSAC 2023 in January 2023.
item.dc:creator: Hara Hiroaki
Yuka Higashi
Masaoki Shoji
item.category: Trend Micro Research : APT & Targeted Attacks
Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Enigma Stealer Targets Cryptocurrency Industry with Fake Jobs
item.description: We discovered an active campaign targeting Eastern Europeans in the cryptocurrency industry using fake job lures.
item.dc:creator: Aliakbar Zahravi
Peter Girnus
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Earth Zhulong: Familiar Patterns Target Southeast Asian Firms
item.description: In 2022, we discovered Earth Zhulong, a hacking group that has been targeting Asian firms similar to another well-known threat actor. In this article, we unravel their new tactics, techniques and procedures that they apply on their misdeeds.
item.dc:creator: Ted Lee
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Hijacking Your Bandwidth: How Proxyware Apps Open You Up to Risk
item.description: In this investigation, we analyzed several prominent "passive income" applications and found out that there may be security risks upon participating in these programs.
item.dc:creator: Trend Micro Research
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: TgToxic Malware’s Automated Framework Targets Southeast Asia Android Users
item.description: We look into an ongoing malware campaign we named TgToxic, targeting Android mobile users in Taiwan, Thailand, and Indonesia since July 2022. The malware steals users’ credentials and assets such as cryptocurrency from digital wallets, as well as money from bank and finance apps. Analyzing the automated features of the malware, we found that the threat actor abused legitimate test framework Easyclick to write a Javascript-based automation script for functions such as clicks and gestures.
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: New APT34 Malware Targets The Middle East
item.description: We analyze an infection campaign targeting organizations in the Middle East for cyberespionage in December 2022 using a new backdoor malware. The campaign abuses legitimate but compromised email accounts to send stolen data to external mail accounts controlled by the attackers.
item.dc:creator: Mohamed Fahmy
Sherif Magdy
Mahmoud Zohdy
item.category: Trend Micro Research : APT & Targeted Attacks
Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: What SOCs Need to Know About Water Dybbuk, A BEC Actor Using Open-Source Toolkits
item.description: We analyze a BEC campaign targeting large companies around the world that was leveraging open-source tools to stay under the radar.
item.dc:creator: Stephen Hilt
Lord Alfred Remorin
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Monthly Threat Webinar Series in 2023: What to Expect
item.description: Stay informed and stay ahead
item.dc:creator: Jon Clay

item.title: New Mimic Ransomware Abuses Everything APIs for its Encryption Process
item.description: Trend Micro researchers discovered a new ransomware that abuses the APIs of a legitimate tool called Everything, a Windows filename search engine developed by Voidtools that offers quick searching and real-time updates for minimal resource usage.
item.dc:creator: Nathaniel Morales
Earle Maui Earnshaw
Don Ovid Ladores
Nick Dai
Nathaniel Gregory Ragasa
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Attacking The Supply Chain: Developer
item.description: In this proof of concept, we look into one of several attack vectors that can be abused to attack the supply chain: targeting the developer. With a focus on the local integrated developer environment (IDE), this proof considers the execution of malicious build scripts via injecting commands when the project or build is incorrectly “trusted”.
item.dc:creator: David Fiser
item.category: Trend Micro Research : APT & Targeted Attacks
Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Vice Society Ransomware Group Targets Manufacturing Companies
item.description: In this blog entry, we’d like to highlight our findings on Vice Society, which includes an end-to-end infection diagram that we were able to create using Trend Micro internal telemetry.
item.dc:creator: Ieriz Nicolle Gonzalez
Paul Pajares
Arianne Dela Cruz
Warren Sto.Tomas
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: “Payzero” Scams and The Evolution of Asset Theft in Web3
item.description: In this entry, we discuss a Web3 fraud scenario where scammers target potential victims via fake smart contracts, and then take over their digital assets, such as NFT tokens, without paying. We named this scam “Payzero”.
item.dc:creator: Fyodor Yarochkin
Vladimir Kropotov
Jay Liao
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Earth Bogle: Campaigns Target the Middle East with Geopolitical Lures
item.description: We discovered an active campaign ongoing since at least mid-2022 which uses Middle Eastern geopolitical-themed lures to distribute NjRAT (also known as Bladabindi) to infect victims across the Middle East and North Africa.
item.dc:creator: Peter Girnus
Aliakbar Zahravi
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Batloader Malware Abuses Legitimate Tools, Uses Obfuscated JavaScript Files in Q4 2022 Attacks
item.description: We discuss the Batloader malware campaigns we observed in the last quarter of 2022, including our analysis of Water Minyades-related events (This is the intrusion set we track behind the creation of Batloader).
item.dc:creator: Junestherry Dela Cruz
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Abusing a GitHub Codespaces Feature For Malware Delivery
item.description: Proof of Concept (POC): We investigate one of the GitHub Codespaces’ real-time code development and collaboration features that attackers can abuse for cloud-based trusted malware delivery. Once exploited, malicious actors can abuse legitimate GitHub accounts to create a malware file server.
item.dc:creator: Nitesh Surana
Magno Logan
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: What is Red Teaming & How it Benefits Orgs
item.description: Running real-world attack simulations can help improve organizations' cybersecurity resilience
item.dc:creator: Michael Draeger
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Gootkit Loader Actively Targets Australian Healthcare Industry
item.description: We analyzed the infection routine used in recent Gootkit loader attacks on the Australian healthcare industry and found that Gootkit leveraged SEO poisoning for its initial access and abused legitimate tools like VLC Media Player.
item.dc:creator: Hitomi Kimura
Ryan Maglaque
Fe Cureg
Trent Bessell
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: CISO's Challenges Involved with Business Leader & SOC
item.description: Yohei Ishihara, IoT security evangelist at Trend Micro, discussed the challenges CISOs facing within organizations driving industrial IoT.
item.dc:creator: Kazuhisa Tagaya

item.title: IcedID Botnet Distributors Abuse Google PPC to Distribute Malware
item.description: We analyze the latest changes in IcedID botnet from a campaign that abuses Google pay per click (PPC) ads to distribute IcedID via malvertising attacks.
item.dc:creator: Ian Kenefick
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Detecting Windows AMSI Bypass Techniques
item.description: We look into some of the implementations that cybercriminals use to bypass the Windows Antimalware Scan Interface (AMSI) and how security teams can detect threats attempting to abuse it for compromise with Trend Micro Vision One™.
item.dc:creator: Jiri Sykora
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Conti Team One Splinter Group Resurfaces as Royal Ransomware with Callback Phishing Attacks
item.description: From September to December, we detected multiple attacks from the Royal ransomware group. In this blog entry, we discuss findings from our investigation of this ransomware and the tools that Royal ransomware actors used to carry out their attacks.
item.dc:creator: Ivan Nicole Chavez
Byron Gelera
Monte de Jesus
Don Ovid Ladores
Khristian Joseph Morales
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: A Technical Analysis of CVE-2022-22583 and CVE-2022-32800
item.description: This blog entry discusses the technical details of how we exploited CVE-2022-22583 using a different method. We also tackle the technical details of CVE-2022-32800, another SIP-bypass that we discovered more recently, in this report.
item.dc:creator: Mickey Jin
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Raspberry Robin Malware Targets Telecom, Governments
item.description: We found samples of the Raspberry Robin malware spreading in telecommunications and government office systems beginning September. The main payload itself is packed with more than 10 layers for obfuscation and is capable of delivering a fake payload once it detects sandboxing and security analytics tools.
item.dc:creator: Christopher So
item.category: Trend Micro Research : APT & Targeted Attacks
Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Diving into an Old Exploit Chain and Discovering 3 new SIP-Bypass Vulnerabilities
item.description: More than two years ago, a researcher, A2nkF demonstrated the exploit chain from root privilege escalation to SIP-Bypass up to arbitrary kernel extension loading. In this blog entry, we will discuss how we discovered 3 more vulnerabilities from the old exploit chain.
item.dc:creator: Mickey Jin
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Web3 IPFS Currently Used For Phishing
item.description: We discuss the use of the InterPlanetary File System (IPFS) in phishing attacks.
item.dc:creator: Matsukawa Bakuei
Morton Swimmer
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: A Closer Look at Windows Kernel Threats
item.description: In this blog entry, we discuss the reasons why malicious actors choose to and opt not to pursue kernel-level access in their attacks. It also provides an overview of kernel-level threats that have been publicly reported from April 2015 to October 2022.
item.dc:creator: Sherif Magdy
Mahmoud Zohdy
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Trend Micro Joins Google’s App Defense Alliance
item.description: Trend Micro will be joining Google's App Defense Alliance (ADA) to help improve their ability to identify malicious apps before they are published to the Google Play store.
item.dc:creator: Jon Clay
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Agenda Ransomware Uses Rust to Target More Vital Industries
item.description: This year, various ransomware-as-a-service groups have developed versions of their ransomware in Rust, including Agenda. Agenda's Rust variant has targeted vital industries like its Go counterpart. In this blog, we will discuss how the Rust variant works.
item.dc:creator: Nathaniel Morales
Ivan Nicole Chavez
Nathaniel Gregory Ragasa
Don Ovid Ladores
Jeffrey Francis Bonaobra
Monte de Jesus
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Ransomware Business Models: Future Pivots and Trends
item.description: Ransomware groups and their business models are expected to change from what and how we know it to date. In this blog entry, we summarize from some of our insights the triggers that spark the small changes in the short term (“evolutions”) and the bigger deviations (“revolutions”) they can redirect their criminal enterprises to in the long run.
item.dc:creator: Feike Hacquebord
Stephen Hilt
David Sancho
item.category: Trend Micro Research : APT & Targeted Attacks
Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Trend Joining App Defense Alliance Announced by Google
item.description: Trend Micro’s participation in Google’s App Defense Alliance will ensure the security of customers by preventing malicious apps from being made available on the Google Play Store.
item.dc:creator: Jon Clay
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Probing Weaponized Chat Applications Abused in Supply-Chain Attacks
item.description: This report examines the infection chain and the pieces of malware used by malicious actors in supply-chain attacks that leveraged trojanized installers of chat-based customer engagement platforms.
item.dc:creator: Jaromir Horejsi
Joseph C Chen
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Forging Ahead in 2023: Insights From Trend Micro’s 2023 Security Predictions
item.description: In 2023, cybercriminals and defenders alike will have to move forward with caution in the face of a business landscape that’s fraught with security blindsides and economic ebbs and flows.

item.title: Linux Cryptocurrency Mining Attacks Enhanced via CHAOS RAT
item.description: We intercepted a cryptocurrency mining attack that incorporated an advanced remote access trojan (RAT) named the CHAOS Remote Administrative Tool.
item.dc:creator: David Fiser
Alfredo Oliveira
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Cybersecurity Reflections from 26 Years at Trend
item.description: Trend Micro is one of the few cybersecurity vendors today that can protect your entire world, whether it is your home office and family, your drive to work, or your work environment.
item.dc:creator: Jon Clay
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Industry 4.0: CNC Machine Security Risks Part 3
item.description: This three-part blog series explores the risks associated with CNC machines
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Industry 4.0: CNC Machine Security Risks Part 2
item.description: This three-part blog series explores the risks associated with CNC machines

item.title: Industry 4.0: CNC Machine Security Risks Part 1
item.description: This three-part blog series explores the risks associated with CNC machines
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Cyber Crime: INTERPOL Uses Trend Threat Intelligence
item.description: INTERPOL recently conducted operation African Surge to take down malicious infrastructure across the African continent and requested the help of private enterprises. Trend Micro is proud to have been asked to participate, and provided global threat intelligence that was utilized in this operation.
item.dc:creator: Jon Clay
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: WannaRen Returns as Life Ransomware, Targets India
item.description: This blog entry looks at the characteristics of a new WannaRen ransomware variant, which we named Life ransomware after its encryption extension.
item.dc:creator: Don Ovid Ladores
Jeffrey Francis Bonaobra
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Earth Preta Spear-Phishing Governments Worldwide
item.description: We break down the cyberespionage activities of advanced persistent threat (APT) group Earth Preta, observed in large-scale attack deployments that began in March. We also show the infection routines of the malware families they use to infect multiple sectors worldwide: TONEINS, TONESHELL, and PUBLOAD.
item.dc:creator: Nick Dai
Vickie Su
Sunny Lu
item.category: Trend Micro Research : APT & Targeted Attacks
Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Global Cyber Risk at Elevated Level
item.description: North America Least Prepared for Cyberattacks
item.dc:creator: Jon Clay

item.title: Electricity/Energy Cybersecurity: Trends & Survey Response
item.description: Based on our survey of over 900 ICS security leaders in the United States, Germany, and Japan, we dig deeper into each industry's challenges and present Trend Micro's recommendations.
item.dc:creator: Mayumi Nishimura

item.title: Pilfered Keys: Free App Infected by Malware Steals Keychain Data
item.description: Open-source applications are a practical way to save money while keeping up with your productivity. However, this can be abused by threat actors to steal your data. Find out how one app was used to gather information of Apple users.
item.dc:creator: Luis Magisa
Qi Sun
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: CVE-2019-8561: A Hard-to-Banish PackageKit Framework Vulnerability in macOS
item.description: This blog entry details our investigation of CVE-2019-8561, a vulnerability that exists in the macOS PackageKit framework, a component used to install software installer packages (PKG files).
item.dc:creator: Mickey Jin
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Hack the Real Box: APT41’s New Subgroup Earth Longzhi
item.description: We looked into the campaigns deployed by a new subgroup of advanced persistent threat (APT) group APT41, Earth Longzhi. This entry breaks down the technical details of the campaigns in full as presented at HITCON PEACE 2022 in August.
item.dc:creator: Hara Hiroaki
Ted Lee
item.category: Trend Micro Research : APT & Targeted Attacks
Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: DeimosC2: What SOC Analysts and Incident Responders Need to Know About This C&C Framework
item.description: This report provides defenders and security operations center teams with the technical details they need to know should they encounter the DeimosC2 C&C framework.
item.dc:creator: Feike Hacquebord
Stephen Hilt
Fernando Merces
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Massive Phishing Campaigns Target India Banks’ Clients
item.description: We found five banking malware families targeting customers of seven banks in India to steal personal and credit card information via phishing campaigns.
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Attack Surface Management 2022 Midyear Review Part 3
item.description: In our 2022 midyear roundup, we examine the most significant trends and incidents that influenced the cybersecurity landscape in the first half of the year.
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Latest on OpenSSL 3.0.7 Bug & Security-Fix
item.description: Potential disruptions following vulnerabilities found in OpenSSL.

item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Manufacturing Cybersecurity: Trends & Survey Response
item.description: Based on our survey of over 900 ICS security leaders in the United States, Germany, and Japan, we dig deeper into each industry's challenges and present Trend Micro's recommendations.
item.dc:creator: Mayumi Nishimura
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Comprehensive Traceability for Android Supply-Chain Security
item.description: We discuss the importance of traceability in the world of mobile operating systems.
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Attack Surface Management 2022 Midyear Review Part 2
item.description: In our 2022 midyear roundup, we examine the most significant trends and incidents that influenced the cybersecurity landscape in the first half of the year.
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Where is the Origin?: QAKBOT Uses Valid Code Signing
item.description: Code signing certificates help us assure the file's validity and legitimacy. However, threat actors can use that against us. In this blog, discover how QAKBOT use such tactic and learn ways how to prevent it.
item.dc:creator: Hitomi Kimura
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: From Bounty to Exploit: Observations About Cybercriminal Contests
item.description: From articles to hackathons, cybercriminals are resorting to crowdsourcing to find more ways to exploit systems. In this blog, we discuss our takeaways and summarize the results of these contests.
item.dc:creator: David Sancho
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Threat Actors Target AWS EC2 Workloads to Steal Credentials
item.description: We found malicious samples attempting to steal Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2) Workloads' access keys and tokens via typosquatting and the abuse of legitimate tools.
item.dc:creator: Nitesh Surana
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Addressing Ransomware in Hospitals & Medical Devices
item.description: Ransomware attacks have been on the rise in recent years, and hospitals are increasingly becoming targets. In many cases, these attacks can have devastating consequences, disrupting vital services and putting patients' lives at risk.
item.dc:creator: Ericka Pingol
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: LV Ransomware Exploits ProxyShell in Attack on a Jordan-based Company
item.description: Our blog entry provides a look at an attack involving the LV ransomware on a Jordan-based company from an intrusion analysis standpoint
item.dc:creator: Mohamed Fahmy
Sherif Magdy
Ahmed Samir
item.category: Trend Micro Research : APT & Targeted Attacks
Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Uncovering Security Blind Spots in CNC Machines
item.description: Industry 4.0 has given rise to smart factories that have markedly improved machining processes, but it has also opened the doors for cybercriminals looking to abuse networked industrial equipment such as CNC machines. Our research investigates potential cyberthreats to CNC machines and how manufacturers can mitigate the associated risks.
item.dc:creator: Marco Balduzzi
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Attack Surface Management 2022 Midyear Review Part 1
item.description: In our 2022 midyear roundup, we examine the most significant trends and incidents that influenced the cybersecurity landscape in the first half of the year.
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: TeamTNT Returns — Or Does It?
item.description: Our honeypots caught malicious cryptocurrency miner samples targeting the cloud and containers, and its routines are reminiscent of the routines employed by cybercriminal group TeamTNT, which was said to have quit in November 2021. Our investigation shows that another threat actor group, WatchDog, might be mimicking TeamTNT’s arsenal.
item.dc:creator: Sunil Bharti
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Oil and Gas Cybersecurity: Trends & Response to Survey
item.description: Based on our survey of over 900 ICS security leaders in the United States, Germany, and Japan, we dig deeper into each industry's challenges and present Trend Micro's recommendations.
item.dc:creator: Mayumi Nishimura
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Black Basta Ransomware Gang Infiltrates Networks via QAKBOT, Brute Ratel, and Cobalt Strike
item.description: We analyzed a QAKBOT-related case leading to a Brute Ratel C4 and Cobalt Strike payload that can be attributed to the threat actors behind the Black Basta ransomware.
item.dc:creator: Ian Kenefick
Lucas Silva
Nicole Hernandez
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: How Water Labbu Exploits Electron-Based Applications
item.description: In the second part of our Water Labbu blog series, we explore how the threat actor exploits Electron-based applications using Cobalt Strike to deploy backdoors.
item.dc:creator: Joseph C Chen
Jaromir Horejsi
item.category: Trend Micro Research : APT & Targeted Attacks
Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Tracking Earth Aughisky’s Malware and Changes
item.description: For over 10 years, security researchers have been observing and keeping tabs of APT group Earth Aughisky’s malware families and the connections, including previously documented malware that have yet to be attributed.
item.dc:creator: CH Lei
item.category: Trend Micro Research : APT & Targeted Attacks
Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Water Labbu Abuses Malicious DApps to Steal Cryptocurrency
item.description: The parasitic Water Labbu capitalizes on the social engineering schemes of other scammers, injecting malicious JavaScript code into their malicious decentralized application websites to steal cryptocurrency.
item.dc:creator: Joseph C Chen
Jaromir Horejsi
item.category: Trend Micro Research : APT & Targeted Attacks
Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Stronger Cloud Security in Azure Functions Using Custom Cloud Container
item.description: In this entry, we discuss how developers can use custom cloud container image and the distroless approach to minimize security gaps in Azure Functions.
item.dc:creator: David Fiser
Alfredo Oliveira
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: How Underground Groups Use Stolen Identities and Deepfakes
item.description: The growing appearance of deepfake attacks is significantly reshaping the threat landscape. These fakes brings attacks such as business email compromise (BEC) and identity verification bypassing to new levels.
item.dc:creator: Vladimir Kropotov
Fyodor Yarochkin
Craig Gibson
Stephen Hilt
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Atlassian Confluence Vulnerability CVE-2022-26134 Abused For Cryptocurrency Mining, Other Malware
item.description: Users are advised to patch immediately: We found exploit samples abusing the Atlassian Confluence vulnerability (CVE-2022-26134) in the wild for malicious cryptocurrency mining.
item.dc:creator: Sunil Bharti
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Security Risks in Logistics APIs Used by E-Commerce Platforms
item.description: Our research examines the security flaws that we found in the logistics API implementation of e-commerce platforms that can potentially expose the consumers’ personal information. We discuss the security risks that such flaws present for software engineers, e-commerce platform providers, and consumers.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Flores
Charles Perine
Lord Alfred Remorin
Roel Reyes
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: The Risk of Ransomware Supply Chain Attacks
item.description: Over the years, ransomware has become a major threat and it can put supply chains in deep trouble.
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: A Post-exploitation Look at Coinminers Abusing WebLogic Vulnerabilities
item.description: This blog entry details how Trend Micro Cloud One™ – Workload Security and Trend Micro Vision One™ effectively detected and blocked the abuse of the CVE-2020-14882 WebLogic vulnerability in affected endpoints.
item.dc:creator: Sunil Bharti
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports
